42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4: Daniel Radcliffe gains access to £20 million fortune as he turns 18. He insists the money won't change him. Radcliffe plans to stay grounded despite growing fame and riches. He has no extravagant spending plans and aims to keep a low profile.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9: Miami-Dade jail's "forgotten floor" houses mentally ill inmates pretrial. Judge advocates for long-term treatment over punishment. Overwhelming volume of mentally ill inmates in Miami jails prompts push for change. Mentally ill patients often circulate through system, facing unjust conditions.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37: Drivers recount harrowing tales of survival after Minneapolis bridge collapse. Rescue efforts were controlled and organized, getting 55 people into ambulances in less than two hours. Survivors describe chaos and disbelief as bridge gives way.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88: President Bush had five polyps removed from his colon. Results are expected in two to three days. Bush is in good humor and will resume his activities. Vice President Dick Cheney assumed presidential power during the procedure.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a: NFL indefinitely suspends Michael Vick without pay for dogfighting involvement. Vick set to appear in court Monday for plea deal. Vick admits to participating in dogfighting ring and killing dogs. Vick agrees to cooperate with investigators and provide information.
a1ebb8bb4d370a1fdf28769206d572be60642d70:
5-year-old Youssif, a burn victim from Iraq, receives overwhelming support worldwide.
The Children's Burn Foundation will cover his medical costs and treatment in the US.
His family faces security risks but remains hopeful for their son's recovery.
7c0e61ac829a3b3b653e2e3e7536cc4881d1f264: Iraqi women turn to prostitution out of desperation to provide for their children. Many feel they have no other options due to violence and lack of government aid. Humanitarian workers are trying to help these women and bring attention to their plight. Prostitution is becoming an increasingly common choice for survival in Iraq.
f0d73bdab711763e745cdc75850861c9018f235d: Key FARC rebel commander "El Negro Acacio" killed in Colombian military air attack. He was involved in extensive cocaine trafficking network. U.S. had been pursuing him since 2002 on drug and kidnapping charges. FARC is Colombia's oldest and largest Marxist rebel group.
5e22bbfc7232418b8d2dd646b952e404df5bd048: White House press secretary Tony Snow will step down on September 14. President Bush praised Snow and announced his resignation. Snow, battling cancer, plans to leave for financial reasons. Bush expressed confidence in Snow's recovery and future contributions.
613d6311ec2c1985bd44707d1796d275452fe156:
Empty rocket launcher tube found on Jersey City lawn, investigated by police and FBI.
Launcher turned over to U.S. Army officials, deemed not a hazard to public safety.
Investigation ongoing to determine origin and circumstances of the rocket launcher's appearance.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219:
President Bush invokes historical lessons of Vietnam to argue against pulling out of Iraq.
Bush will make the argument that withdrawing from Vietnam emboldened today's terrorists.
White House attempts to reframe the debate over Iraq as public support for the war sags.
85f55a3e0dd672857aaaaa80954934a57b7a2fbf:
- Chronology of bombings and attempted bomb attacks in the mainland UK since the 1970s
- Series of bomb attacks by IRA and Islamic militants targeting various locations in UK
- Incidents include bombings in London, Manchester, and other cities, resulting in numerous casualties
77d7c8cf2a9432e395d629371a12790c563c19f7: Carlos Alberto joins Werder Bremen for record fee. He aims to win titles with the club. Bundesliga champions VfB Stuttgart sign Brazilian player Ewerthon. Ailton returns to Germany, signing with Duisburg.
35f0e33de7923036a97ac245d899f990bda5e242: Vice President Cheney to serve as acting president during Bush's colonoscopy. Bush's last colonoscopy was in 2002 with no abnormalities found. Procedure to be supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb at Camp David. Snow undergoing chemotherapy for colon cancer.
2ad31cae96512af5105b9b23f9b681dc732b2605: A magnitude 4.2 earthquake shook the San Francisco area. About 2,000 customers were left without power. The quake was considered "light" and caused minimal damage. The shaking lasted about 50 seconds.
0d43b97000ff852282c89d8d105e41495c0ee9bd:
- No hope of finding six trapped miners alive in Utah coal mine.
- Rescue efforts exhausted, oxygen levels too low for human life.
- Families devastated as search operation comes to an end.
bf0cd4ccacd4fe045995338f4c44d9cf18000226:
- Bomb blast in Batna, Algeria kills 14, wounds 60
- President's visit unaffected, no immediate claim of responsibility
- Algeria faces ongoing Islamic insurgency, previous suicide bombings
2f43e9dfaa43ffbddbce339a8b6403ddce43b38a: David Beckham joins U.S. Major League Soccer with Los Angeles Galaxy. CNN explores Beckham's rise to stardom and Hollywood transition. The article delves into Beckham's career, family life, and impact on U.S. soccer. Beckham's move to L.A. prompts questions about his celebrity adaptation.
eb68bc51ed4fc727a1af058192a3fef0916c91e7:
- Australian honey bees may be linked to U.S. colony collapse.
- Virus IAPV found in healthy Australian bees but not causing symptoms.
- Colony collapse likely caused by multiple factors, not just virus.
ad021a7924ee57491cee8576499ac196b1afeb23:
Customers line up to empty accounts at UK mortgage bank after bailout.
Northern Rock faces mass withdrawals despite reassurances from bank and government.
Bank of England steps in to stabilize banking system amidst global credit crunch.
9d7fc7fd9ffbfecb1c458b9929fa02e6c3538368: O.J. Simpson arrested on robbery and assault charges, held without bail. Alleged armed robbery of sports memorabilia in Las Vegas hotel. Simpson accused of directing men in the robbery. Firearms involved, but no one was roughed up.
30cb674030b01014d2c87b92f09152857e249631: Nigeria's TV survival show suspended after contestant drowns in preparation. Show sponsored by Dutch brewer Heineken's local unit. Contestant's death leads to show suspension and raises safety concerns.
d41dc7fc05273a37f0aceaf4f3e35a187f12653e: Former government contract employee indicted for stealing nuclear materials and putting US at risk. Materials taken from East Tennessee Technology Park. Indictment alleges communication and transfer of classified data. Sting operation intervened before involvement of foreign country.
fbc6a4d0697b2a3e8b549dcb1f80a8ce7bf47e34: Chelsea's John Terry waits on fitness for Champions League match. Frank Lampard ruled out. Manager Grant confirms Lampard's absence. Essien expected to play despite leg injury.
0753a471e6908c35bcbc2daa37e21f3a8443b590:
- Organ trafficking and black market for organs in poorer countries
- Lack of transparency and protection for donors spurs international calls for regulation
- Cultural barriers and legal loopholes contribute to the organ trade
08450c1bc03472825196be1acb02ac0e13bef939: Lindsay Lohan's legal troubles raise questions about insurability for future movies. Industry experts discuss the potential high cost and conditions for insuring problematic stars. Hollywood awaits decision on Lohan's role in upcoming film "Poor Things." Insurers may impose serious terms, including higher deductibles and risk management measures.
7fa8d9beca50155fd3d71a9087a4311ce321c34b: Francesco Totti threatens to quit Italian Players Association over Serie A start date. Totti complains Italian players are not listened to. Italian Football League ignored request to start season earlier for Euro 2008 qualifiers. Serie A start date conflict prompts Totti to consider leaving players association.
414a5b8ecbe189d2767c75b839775a1dcafaf4d3:
Blackwater denies involvement in unlawful arms activities in Iraq.
Federal prosecutors are investigating allegations of illegal weapons purchases by Blackwater employees.
State Department Inspector General confirms cooperation with Blackwater probe.
cac7a712935380d74410a7cba8d406235d51249a:
5-year-old burned Iraqi boy meets favorite superhero, Spider-Man, at Universal Studios.
Boy enjoys being a child again, playing with SpongeBob and riding tram at the studio.
Family experiences generosity and peaceful side of America, finding hope and happiness.
e9093ca0a82f2aba28cd2762942c04177cfbb000: Marine convicted in Iraqi civilian death receives rank reduction and discharge. Thomas found guilty of kidnapping and conspiracy in 2006 death. Squad leader accused of dragging victim from home and shooting him. Marines reported victim planned to detonate roadside bomb, but residents gave different account.
55a6aabd120f0b18297f7efe22452f9b3aca0d8d: Prince Harry pays tribute to Princess Diana on 10th anniversary of her death. He describes her as "the best mother in the world" in a moving speech. The Bishop of London also speaks about Diana's public work and impact. He urges to let her rest in peace and remember her with compassion.
06bc2f0272d033b123e9eebbb221c62d7d51c283: French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner challenges convention and authority. He supports US-led intervention in Iraq based on human rights. France's new high-profile style under President Sarkozy includes warnings to Iran. France is reclaiming a role at the top diplomatic tables.
17e43e8e7d2bbbb237df78537d108c3fa917d9fb:
- Beethoven's "Für Elise" likely not written for anyone named Elise.
- Elton John's "Philadelphia Freedom" dedicated to Billie Jean King.
- The Kinks' "Lola" inspired by a transvestite, possibly Candy Darling.
ddcdeb9bdd19fa23f9495c85d48eeee910f33102:
- Historic spending expected for political and issue-advocacy advertising in 2008 election cycle.
- Former Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney leads TV ad spending among presidential contenders.
- Cost to influence 2008 election could exceed $3 billion, nearly double 2004 spending.
ee0ba7928d8987f2cb21c9a2012a76730f77de45: Relatives arrive in Phuket to identify plane crash victims. Many foreign nationals among the 89 killed. Investigation into crash continues, focusing on weather conditions and pilot decision-making. Low-cost airline's safety practices questioned amidst tragedy.
554fd99f28ae12472c5d99ef6383bb184744c25a: Michael Moore and CNN's Sanjay Gupta argued about Gupta's report on Moore's film "Sicko." Moore criticized Gupta's report, saying the facts were not fudged. Both agreed on the basic premise of "Sicko": Problems abound in America's health-care system. Gupta praised Moore for raising awareness but raised concerns about the portrayal of universal health care in other countries.
9e141ebc1c06d483bf85f4e5c8b3c7bc2d00ea2f: Some Democrats are reconsidering a resolution on Armenian genocide labeling. Turkey's threat to block U.S. access to Incirlik Air Base raises concerns. Pentagon prepares alternative supply routes for troops in Iraq. U.S. officials fear resolution could complicate Iraqi stability.
c9160e2f5ce386dabb10517e7a5c0933c01a9546: Twelve-year-old Mohammed Rasoul, who lost his leg in Iraq, is set to receive medical treatment in the United States. A charity has arranged for surgery and treatment at a hospital in Philadelphia. Mohammed hopes to rebuild Falluja and become an architect in the future.
d256aee1a47eb5b489dee6fb72ab7f7d1483a37f: India elects first female president, Pratibha Patil, in historic victory. Patil aims to address women's issues and promote their influence. Her win is seen as a milestone for women in India. Patil's presidency comes amid controversy and criticism over her past statements and actions.
2fff2bc541ef34a6647dfa2e4294cdcc187e47b9:
More than 100 homes evacuated in San Diego landslide.
Mayor declares state of emergency, seeks aid from government.
Hillside community warned of shifting ground for weeks.
677375a4c69e81ab623af7c06a6b0a8d03d6350e:
French charity's attempt to take children from Chad for adoption questioned by aid agencies.
Zoe's Ark workers and journalists arrested for trying to take children to France.
Chadian authorities accuse charity of kidnapping and concealing children's identities.
33530f97118cc905b05cb920671492c7bfdf3a3b: Explorer discovers new island near Greenland, revealing impact of climate change. Global warming experts warn of potential catastrophic consequences. Debate continues over human contribution to warming trend and its implications. Uncertainties persist in predicting future climate changes and their effects.
3c19a753303ae0d67b3ae28e070c0f4157ffc52d: An enraged crowd in Somalia dragged the body of an Ethiopian soldier through the streets. Gun battles with Islamic insurgents killed 19 people in Mogadishu. Ethiopian troops arrived in Somalia in December 2006 to help the weak Somali government. The fighting has driven hundreds of people from their homes.
9313988d26672c576f08e130c895edf20d8aa626:

- Judge signed order to exhume body of Drew Peterson's third wife
- New information raises questions about death of Peterson's third wife
72f4a6670ec7ec915c83d58bb0ebf152b1605bb6: Julia Vakulenko will face Lindsay Davenport in her first WTA Tour final. Vakulenko seeks her first victory on the WTA Tour. Davenport is seeking her second win in three tournaments since returning from a one-year hiatus.
b73f50e29d5b2943eb315643bef8ee4e09f5605b: Pakistani President Musharraf declares state of emergency, orders arrests and media crackdown. International condemnation follows. Musharraf claims emergency is short-lived and aims to restore law and order. Political tension escalates as opposition leaders are placed under house arrest.
f9689fb9656132e1c6d186851563f2b968643791: Chief operating officer of National Children's Museum arrested for distributing child pornography. Accused of sending images to undercover detective posing as a 12-year-old girl. Museum officials express horror and suspend the officer from his post. Singer faces up to 140 years in prison if convicted on all counts.
63831b842812b1a3d05b04904a10d160fe7ad2af: Chester Arthur Stiles appeared in court on charges of raping a 2-year-old girl. The total charges against him are 23 felony counts. The girl's mother expressed relief at Stiles' arrest and plans to testify against him.
05688bac0e46542be65a6df240428a6f26c86fd0: South African bowler Dale Steyn took career-best 5-34 against New Zealand. South Africa piled on the agony with a lead of 287. Hashim Amla and Jacques Kallis shared an unbeaten stand of 159.
